intro: Sphaerostephanos subpectinatus, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has pinnately divided leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is typically found in alpine or arctic regions. Sphaerostephanos subpectinatus is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
